description: Remotely browse and edit any GitHub repository
colors.possibleConflict: Color for resources with possible conflicts
colors.workspaceRepositoriesView.hasUnco: Color for workspace repositories that have uncommitted changes
config.autoFetch.enabled: Specifies whether to periodically fetch from the upstream repository
config.autoFetch.interval: Specifies the interval, in seconds, to periodically fetch from the upstream repository
config.azureRepos.enabled: Specifies whether to enable Azure Repos support
config.commitDirectlyWarning: Specifies whether to show a warning that changes will be committed directly to the remote provider (e.g. GitHub)
config.logLevel: Specifies how much (if any) to log to the _GitHub Repositories_ output channel
config.logLevel.info: Logs all errors, warnings, and messages
config.logLevel.debug: Logs all errors, warnings, and messages with extra context useful for debugging
config.richNavigation.enabled: Specifies whether to enable rich navigation if the repository is indexed
config.search.download.corsProxy: Specifies the proxy to use when downloading repository indexes from a browser context
config.search.download.sizeLimit: Specifies the size (in MB) of search index cache. The search cache is located in the extension's global storage folder
config.search.download.repoLimit: Specifies the maximum number of search indexes cached per repo. Each reference requires a separate search index
config.staging.enabled: Specifies whether to enable the staging of changes before committing
config.staging.smart: Specifies whether to automatically stage all changes, if there are none, before committing
config.experimental.prefetch: Specifies whether to attempt prefetching tree loading (for performance testing)
config.experimental.fs.useTars: Specifies whether to attempt to use tar files for file system operations
config.experimental.useNewCommitApi: Specifies whether to use GitHub's new `createCommitOnBranch` GraphQL API to commit.
viewsWelcome.explorer:
You can remotely open a repository or pull request without cloning.
[Open Remote Repository](command:remoteHub.openRepository)
viewsWelcome.explorer.web:
You can remotely open a repository or pull request.
[Open Remote Repository](command:remoteHub.openRepository)
viewsWelcome.scm.web:
You can remotely open a repository or pull request.
[Open Remote Repository](command:remoteHub.openRepository)
viewsWelcome.debug: Run and Debug are not available in the web editor. To run and debug, you will need to continue in an environment that can run code, like a codespace or local VS Code.
viewsWelcome.debug.continueOn: [Continue Working On...](command:remoteHub.continueOn 'Continue working on this Remote repository elsewhere')
viewsWelcome.terminal: Terminals are not available in the web editor. To use the terminal, you will need to continue in an environment that can run code, like a codespace or local VS Code.
viewsWelcome.terminal.continueOn: [Continue Working On...](command:remoteHub.continueOn 'Continue working on this Remote repository elsewhere')
viewsWelcome.remoteExplorer:
Your recently-opened remote repositories are displayed here.
[Open Remote Repository](command:remoteHub.openRepository)
